description:
Zeebo's version of Double Dragon follows the same plot, but bearing several changes. Once again, Billy and Jimmy Lee are off to rescue Marian, Billy's girlfriend, kidnapped by Machine Gun Willy and his gang.

The gameplay is the same as in Double Dragon, a beat'em up for one or two players. Billy and Jimmy can move in eight directions, jump, punch and kick. Several moves are available by combining those basic commands, such as running, head bumps, flying kicks, elbow punches, hair grabbing, etc. Some enemies will drop weapons when hit, which can be used by the players. The weapons available are knives, steel bats, whips, dynamite sticks, hand axes, flails and nunchucks. Oil drums found throughout the levels can be picked up and thrown at or kicked toward enemies for extra damage.

The game was expanded from four to six missions, with only the first, second and the last taking place in the same locations as the arcade version, although bearing minor layout changes. The other 3 missions are completely new ones. Except for Willy, all enemies are new, though sometimes clearly inspired in the original ones. The graphics are also slightly more detailed than the arcade version, with a 16-bit touch.

The game features an extra battle mode: after finishing the game with Billy (and Jimmy), players can replay the game as the baddies, summing up to 18 different unlockable characters. Each baddie has its own moves and some of them can use some of the available weapons. At first, only Billy, Jimmy and two baddies will be available; as the player finishes the game with different characters, more baddies are unlocked. There are three levels of difficulty and options to increase the amount of characters' lives and continues.

sample_screenshots.caption: The enemies are coming from the door right next to Billy's garage, what a wonderful neighborhood!
Main menu. From here you can select 1 or 2 players games, the Extra Battle mode, the help menu, the options menu and exit the game.
The second stage boss. I asked gently to the guy who took Marian if he couldn't just let her go. This was his reply.
Zeebo in game advertising. Billy is probably thinking: "cool, I'll buy it so I can play as myself in Double Dragon".
A two players game. Unlike most versions of Double Dragon, Billy is the brown-haired and Jimmy the blond one.

title: Double Dragon

description:
Zeebo Extreme Rolimã is the first episode on the Zeebo Extreme series, a series of Zeebo-exclusive sports games developed to make use of Zeebo's accelerometer controller, the Boomerang.

This is a racing game featuring rolimã carts, a kind of soapbox cart popular in Brazil. Players can select one out of four characters (with no influence to the gameplay). There are 3 downhill courses available, located in popular Brazilian cities: São Paulo (easy), Petrópolis (medium) and Ouro Preto (hard).

As it is a downhill racing game, there's no acceleration button. There is a turbo button though, as well a brake button and a drift button.

sample_screenshots.caption: In game advertising. But hey, if I'm playing this I already have a Zeebo, don't you think?
Don't bother stopping at the toll gate, rolimã carts are toll-free.
Title screen and main menu.
Finished!
The head-to-head character selection screen.

title: Zeebo Extreme Rolimã

description:
Zeebo Extreme Corrida Aérea is the second episode on the Zeebo Extreme series, a series of Zeebo-exclusive sports games developed to make use of Zeebo's accelerometer controller, the Boomerang.

This is a racing game featuring airplanes. Players can select one out of four pilots (with no influence to the gameplay). There are 3 course available, easy, medium and hard, with 3 laps each.

Controlling the airplane with the Z-Pad the upper buttons make close turns. The Boomerang must be used in the vertical position, and the 1 and 2 buttons are used to turbo thrust the airplane. Rings are scattered through the courses and flying through them recharges the airplane turbo.

sample_screenshots.caption: Though some areas look wide open, the track is pretty delimited: if the plane flies away from the track it is respawned back.
The results screen. This time I got first. Here you can choose to race again or exit.
The options menu. All text here is in Portuguese as this is the Brazilian release of the game. Unlike other Zeebo games, this one doesn't allow the player to choose a language.
Title screen and main menu.
Character selection. You have 4 characters to choose from, but they're only really different in appearance. The choice doesn't affect gameplay.

title: Zeebo Extreme Corrida Aérea

description:
Tectoy's Zeebo console comes with different embedded games, depending on the country released.

The Brazilian release has 3 embedded games:

  • FIFA Soccer 09
  • Need for Speed: Carbon - Domine a Cidade
  • Treino Cerebral

The Mexican release has 5 embedded games:

  • Crash Bandicoot Nitro Kart 3D
  • Pac-Mania
  • Tekken 2
  • Zenonia
  • Zeebo Family Pack

In September, 2010, Zeebo was re-released in Brazil with a new set of embedded games:

  • Treino Cerebral
  • Zeebo Extreme Bóia Cross
  • Zeebo Sports Vôlei
title: Zeebo (included games)

description:
Boomerang Sports Tênis is a game of doubles inspired by Wii Sports. It is the first title to exclusively use the Boomerang, Zeebo's accelerometer controller (different from the Zeebo Extreme series, which also supports the Z-Pad; however, the game was later re-released to support the Z-Pad). Players must swing the Boomerang like a racket to hit the ball while the characters move automatically around the court.

One or two players can choose doubles among 10 characters dressed in the most various ways (like a geisha, a cook, a nurse, a man in a cow costume, etc.). As the characters win matches, they grow on points which unlock new rackets (again in varied forms, such as a guitar, a rake, a pan, a broom, etc.). The game length and player's hand side can also be selected.

The game features also an online ranking on Zeebo-net in which players can compare their achievements. The ranking can be updated daily by players.

sample_screenshots.caption: Creating a user profile.
Selecting the length of match. You can choose 1 game, best-of-3, best-of-5 or a full set.
Selecting the state you're located. This is only for identification purposes and doesn't affect on gameplay.
Selecting your hand side.
This is the online raking screen. With 138 points, MobyGamer is listed as #369 of the ranking.

title: Boomerang Sports Tênis

description:
Zeebo Extreme Baja is the third episode on the Zeebo Extreme series, a series of Zeebo-exclusive sports games developed to make use of Zeebo's accelerometer controller, the Boomerang.

This is a racing game featuring mini baja cars, a kind of small off-road cars similar to dune buggies. Players can select one out of four characters (with no influence to the gameplay). There are 3 courses available, located in Brazilian cities: Camboriú (easy), Piracicaba (medium) and São Roque de Minas (hard). The game features a one-on-one split-screen mode also.

When controlling the game with the Z-Pad the upper buttons make the car drift. There is an accelerator button, a break button and a turbo button. Oil gallons are scattered through the courses and driving over them recharges the car's turbo (bigger gallons grant bigger recharges).

sample_screenshots.caption: This track also has a looping.
This track has tunnels and water crossing.
Finished!
That oil gallon refills my turbo. Different colors have different amounts of oil.
Title screen and main menu.

title: Zeebo Extreme Baja

description:
Boomerang Sports Vôlei is a beach volleyball game. It is the second title to exclusively use the Boomerang, Zeebo's accelerometer controller (different from the Zeebo Extreme series, which also supports the Z-Pad; however, the game was later re-released to support the Z-Pad). Players must swing the Boomerang to hit the ball while the characters move automatically around the court. The buttons are used to jump and to block. The d-pad on the Boomerang is used to change the camera view.

One or two players can choose doubles among 10 characters dressed in the most various ways (like a geisha, a cook, a nurse, a man in a walrus costume, etc.). As the characters win matches, they grow on points which unlock new clothes. The game length and player's hand side can also be selected.

The game features also an online ranking on Zeebo-net in which players can compare their achievements. The ranking can be updated daily by players.

sample_screenshots.caption: When you score the characters will cheer up.
Selecting your hand side.
Depending on your score, the camera changes sides.
Selecting the characters in your double. As you play matches with each of them, their levels increase and it affects the difficulty level of the opponents.
If the opponent scores, your characters will mourn.

title: Boomerang Sports Vôlei

description:
Zeebo Extreme Jetboard is the fifth episode on the Zeebo Extreme series, a series of Zeebo-exclusive sports games developed to make use of Zeebo's accelerometer controller, the Boomerang.

This is a slalom racing game featuring riders propelled by jet-packs over wakeboards. Players can select one out of four characters (with no influence to the gameplay). There are 3 courses available, located in popular Brazilian beaches: Angra dos Reis (easy), Vitória (medium) and Fernando de Noronha (hard).

There are buttons for accelerating, braking, activating turbo and maneuvering. Passing by the indicated side of obstacles charges the player's turbo. Missing 5 obstacles casts the player out of the race. Jumping over ramps allow the player to make maneuvers which can also charge turbo.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here we have a sideflip for 50 points.
Jumping over a ramp inside a tunnel at the Vitória track.
Player two missed 5 obstacles and is eliminated.
If you make a mistake while performing a trick your character can fall into the water, losing some seconds.
The results screen. This time I got first. Here you can choose to race again or exit.

title: Zeebo Extreme Jetboard

description:
Zeebo Extreme Bóia-Cross is the fourth episode on the Zeebo Extreme series, a series of Zeebo-exclusive sports games developed to make use of Zeebo's accelerometer controller, the Boomerang.

This is an acqua ride game, a sport similar to rafting. Players can select one out of four characters (with no influence to the gameplay). There are 3 rapid courses available, located in popular Brazilian locations: Santo André (easy), Bonito (medium) and Caverna do Diabo (hard).

As it is a rapid racing game, there's no acceleration button. There is a "breath" button though (which boosts the raft speed), as well a brake button and a drift button. Items collected along the courses can recharge players' breath meter.

sample_screenshots.caption: I was hit by a boomerang and my raft got turned.
This is the Bonito track. I just collected the "boomerang" item. Using it can turn opponents' rafts upside-down.
Taking the energy drink item will boost the player for a few seconds.
The loading screen shows tips like how the game is controlled using the Z-Pad.
Whenever the player crashes and stops, he/she will be respawned. A big yellow "X" crosses the screen while the raft is put back on track.

title: Zeebo Extreme Bóia-Cross

description:
Boomerang Sports Queimada is a dodgeball game. It is the third title to exclusively use the Boomerang, Zeebo's accelerometer controller (different from the Zeebo Extreme series, which also supports the Z-Pad; however, the game was later re-released to support the Z-Pad). Players must swing the Boomerang to throw the ball or to dodge while the characters move automatically around the court. The buttons are used to taunt and to pass the ball (when attacking) or grabbing it (when defending). The d-pad on the Boomerang is used to jump the camera view.

One or two players can choose teams formed by 4 members. The team members all look identical, and they are the same characters from the previous games in the series. As the characters win matches, they grow on points. The player's hand side can also be selected.

The game features also an online ranking on Zeebo-net in which players can compare their achievements. The ranking can be updated daily by players.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game offers two selectable camera angles: partial and total. This is the total camera.
If the opponent scores, your characters will mourn.
Selecting our new user profile.
Before you play for the first time the game gives you the instructions on how to handle the Boomerang.
After each match, this screen shows how many points each character won. The longer the game and better the scoring, the more you win points. Losing points is also possible.

title: Boomerang Sports Queimada

description:
Un Juego de Huevos ("A Game of Eggs") is based on the Mexican animation movie Una Película de Huevos. The game has one of the movie characters, Confi, telling what happened in the quest of another egg, Toto, to become a chicken.

The player controls Toto through 25 platform levels, divided in 5 stages which take place in locations such as the sewers, a forest, an icy mountain and a cave. Toto yields a lollipop as a weapon and he can jump, attack forward, up and down. After collecting a blanket, he can use it as a parachute to fall slowly. He starts with only 2 "eggs" of health (shown in an egg tray at a corner of the screen), but collecting golden-egg items will increase it up to twelve. The enemies faced will vary according to the stage (rats in the sewers, reptile eggs in the forest, shells in the cave, etc.), with a final boss at the end of each of the 5 stages. The objective of each level is to get to its end while collecting blue jewels. If all blue jewels in a level are collected, a giant blue jewel is awarded. Getting to the end of a level awards a giant red jewel. Beating a boss awards a diamond. Jewels are necessary to unlock levels. At the beginning of the game, Toto will be in a general world stage with only the level 1-1 will be unlocked, and the player has the option to go through the levels within a stage in the order he wishes, provided he has the amount of jewels needed to unlock the stages.

The co-op mode adds Willy, a military egg, to the game. Willy can be added at any time through the in-game menu. He yields a club and has the same movements as Toto. Toto and Willy share the same screen and if one of them gets too far from the other, one of them disappears from the screen, with an arrow showing where he has been left.

The game can also be played by two players competitively in a race mode, with ten unlockable competition levels. The races put Toto and Willy trying to reach the finish line first while collecting jewels. As they race, if one of them gets much ahead of the other, the other will get stuck in the edge of the screen. At the end of the race, the winner is the one with more points, calculated by the number of jewels taken, being the first to arrive at the finish line and the number of times the player got stuck.

Finishing the game will unlock a new secret character and collecting all the jewels in the game will unlock another. The game features cutscenes between levels with voice-overs (in Spanish) by the same actors who voiced the characters in the movie.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the second stage Toto will travel through the sewers. His enemies will be mostly rats like these.
Title screen.
The fifth and last state is at caves. Bats and magma rocks will be common there. Toto can perform wall jumps just like this to climb up otherwise unreachable spots.
Toto and Willy wait for the checkered flag to wave.
In the third stage confi will travel through a forest. Reptile eggs will fight him.

title: Un Juego de Huevos

description:
Boomerang Sports Peteca is, as the name implies, a peteca game, a sport similar to badminton, with the shuttlecock being hit with the player's hand instead of a racket. It is the fourth title to exclusively use the Boomerang, Zeebo's accelerometer controller (different from the Zeebo Extreme series, which also supports the Z-Pad; however, the game was later re-released to support the Z-Pad). Players must swing the Boomerang to hit the ball while the characters move automatically around the court. Buttons 1 and 2 are used to move the player right or left before serving.

One or two players can choose among 10 characters dressed in the most various ways (like a geisha, a cook, a nurse, etc.). As the characters win matches, they grow on points which unlock new items. The game length and player's hand side can also be selected.

The characters move around the court in different speeds. Green (with a plus sign) and red (with a minus sign) frames of different sizes appear in the court floor, adding or subtracting speed from the player who walks over them (the bigger the frame, the greater the effect). A red bar near the players show their current speed. Players can try to throw the shuttlecock over a red frame forcing the opponent to walk over them, thus slowing him or her down.

There are 4 possible courts. The default is a gymnasium one, while the other 3 can be unlocked if the player has any of the other previous Boomerang Sports games installed in his Zeebo.

The game features also an online ranking on Zeebo-net in which players can compare their achievements. The ranking can be updated daily by players.

sample_screenshots.caption: When you hit the shuttlecock while standing over a green panel, your speed bar will be raised.
Selecting your hand side.
Selecting the length of match. You can choose 3, 7, 11 or 17 points.
If the opponent scores, your character will mourn.
Even if you're jumping when you hit the shuttlecock, your speed will be affected by the panels below.

title: Boomerang Sports Peteca

description:
The Hordes of Octo are back and are spread all over the 10 zones of the galaxy. It is your task to restore the freedom eliminating them.

The goal in Alien Breaker is to destroy all battalions, represented by blocks on the screen, by bouncing a ball off of a horizontally moving paddle at the bottom of the screen. The blocks are colored and may change colors when hit, until they disappear. Levels are won by clearing all blocks from the screen and lost by letting the ball fall out of the bottom of the screen. This Zeebo version expands the previous iPhone version with twice the amount of levels and a new storyline.

As some blocks are hit, 27 different bonus items can be released and fall down the screen. If the player catches them with the paddle, gameplay changes occur, like making the paddle bigger or smaller, adding a shield at the bottom of the screen, exploding a series of blocks, equipping the paddle with projectiles, etc. A female voice announces the changes that take place.

There are four playing modes available: Arcade, Challenge, Versus and Fronton. The Arcade and Challenge modes comprise 100 levels divided in 10 zones represented by planets named after Greek letters (Alpha, Beta, Gama, etc.).

sample_screenshots.caption: When playing the challenge mode you can always try again.
Gameplay in the Omega Zone. The player just got a multi-ball bonus and 9 balls are spread all over the screen.
With the fire bonus it becomes easier to clean the stages.
After beating a level, a vortex will lead the player to the next level.
Title screen.

title: Alien Breaker

description:
Zeebo F.C. Foot Camp is a compilation of four soccer themed mini-games:

  • Goal Scoring: working with two teammates, the player has to score from the penalty mark. Points are awarded for goals scored and multiplied by consecutive goals scored. Extra points plates are shown inside the goal, which are awarded if hit. Some special power-ups are available; two of them are drawn at the start of each game. The power-ups for this game are:

    • Points multiplier: multiplies the player's points while it lasts;
    • Rebound: if the goalie palms the ball, one of the two teammates at the sides performs a rebound kick and scores;
    • Chicken goalie: turns the goalie into a chicken who runs from the ball;
    • Freezing ball: this ball will freeze the goalie for a while.

  • Free Kick: the player has to score a free kick against wind speed, goalie position, goal direction and barrier. Points are awarded for goals scored and multiplied by consecutive goals scored. The following power-ups are available:

    • Points multiplier: multiplies the player's points while it lasts;
    • Shrinking: shrinks the goalie and barrier for a kick;
    • Abduction: aliens abduct all opponents for a kick;
    • Freeze opponents: freezes the goalie and barrier for a kick.

  • Dribble: the player has to type a sequence of buttons displayed on screen to perform dribbles. The more accurate the sequence is done, the more beautiful the dribble is. The difficulty grows for each adversary, being the goalie the boss. Power-ups available:

    • Points multiplier: multiplies the player's points while it lasts;
    • Chicken opponent: turns an opponent into a chicken. The dribble is automatically successful;
    • Hurricane Dribble: turns all dribble commands into directional spins;
    • Freeze time: the time stops for a while, giving the player more time to perform a dribble.

  • Juggle: in this game, the player has to keep the ball in the air as long as possible, using his feet, knees and head to bump it. Points are awarded for ball time in the air and for variety of maneuver. The more a maneuver is repeated, the less points it awards. A flying bonus hen passes over the player from time to time; hitting it awards bonus points. The power-ups available are:

    • Points multiplier: multiplies the player's points while it lasts;
    • Saving hen: if the ball falls to the ground, the saving hen will put it in game again;
    • Balloon ball: turns the ball into a balloon, making it fall slower that normal;
    • Flock: causes a flock of flying bonus hens.

Each mini-game has its own ranking, and there is a general ranking for all games. The game is played using customized avatars. Each avatar has 4 skills which can be developed up to the level 30. The skills are Strength (developed in the Goal Scoring game), Precision (developed in the Free Kick game), Reflexes (developed in the Dribble game) and Ball Control (developed in the Juggle game). The development of skills also unlocks 20 Achievements. Twelve achievements unlock 12 special uniforms and 3 achievements unlock extra content in the game Zeebo F.C. Super League.

This game is also the first to be compatible with Zeeboids, an app sold separately which allows players to create custom avatars (similar to Wii's Miis), which can be synchronized via the Zeebonet to be used in different Zeebo systems. When played using the Zeeboids, the game features an online ranking.

sample_screenshots.caption: This screen appears before each event starts. The slot machine will stop if you press a key, revealing your power ups for the event. This time I got the Chicken goalie and the Rebound power ups.
You can pass the ball to your teammates on the sides to confuse the goalie.
Just used the "Chicken goalie" power up. The goalie turns into a chicken, missing some defenses.
Selecting a profile. If you have the Zeeboids app installed, you can play with your customized Zeeboid. Here I made one using MobyGames' colors.
Just got a perfect dribble; the ball went over the opponent's head.

title: Zeebo F.C. Foot Camp

description: Zeebo Sports Badminton is essentially the same game as Zeebo Sports Peteca, the difference being that peteca is a sport played with a shuttlecock without a racket. The game bears the same gameplay and features as Zeebo Sports Peteca, with the theme being modified to badminton to better please non-Brazilian audiences, unfamiliar with the peteca sport.
title: Zeebo Sports Badminton

alternate_titles.title: Tork and Kral: A Prehistorik Adventure

description:
Ragor, a mad scientist, travelled to the past and kidnapped Kama, the chief's daughter. The two best warriors of the clan, Tork and Kral, are off to save her.

Tork and Kral is a platform game similar to Mario Bros., with an ice age setting. The players have to kill all enemies in each level to complete it. The levels are stationary and the screen will only scroll vertically when the player climbs over the upper platforms. Some enemies move about the level (like dinosaurs, bears and bats) while others are stationary (like spore plants and snowmen). In some levels there are eggs which will spawn enemies regularly until destroyed.

Tork and Kral can use their clubs to fight the enemies. There are two power-ups available for their clubs: fire and ice. Both work the same way, blasting fire or ice balls against the enemies, trapping them; the stronger the enemy is, the shorter they will stay trapped. There are also three kinds of special weapons which can be picked and used once: the gum, which allows Tork and Kral to release a bubble which can trap an enemy; the scream, which kills a wave of enemies in front of it; and the fart, which suffocates enemies while it spreads in the air. Other bonuses are:* Speed up: speeds up the character;

  • Freeze: freezes all enemies on screen;
  • Fruit: increases the score;
  • Zeebo Ball: makes the character invincible for a while;
  • Thunder: kills all enemies on screen, making the player advance a level;
  • 1 Up: one extra life;
  • Letters: collecting the letters E, X, T, R and A awards the player an extra life, making the player advance one level.

The game has 60 levels divided in three stages with 20 levels each, taking place in the forest, the mountain and the cave. Every fifth level is a bonus level, where the player has to climb platforms while taking fruits as the screen automatically scrolls up. Every tenth level is a boss stage, with a fire blasting mammoth to be defeated. The game can be played by one or two players cooperatively. There is also an "Escape" gameplay mode, where the objective is to keep climbing the platforms avoiding to be catch by the forced scrolling screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game Over.
Stage 2. When the player gets the ice power up, he can freeze the enemies and then blow them against the other enemies.
The help screen also shows all enemies and their respective descriptions.
A cooperative two players game. Tork and Kral share the load of killing all those enemies.
Stage 3. Collecting letters to form the word "Extra" grants the player an extra life and sends him or her to the next level.

title: Tork and Kral

description:
Turma da Mônica em Vamos Brincar nº 1 is the only out of the planned six games in a series of educational games on Zeebo featuring Mônica's Gang, one of the most popular comics in Brazil. It is an activity center with 6 different activities:

  • Popping balloons: the player must help Anjinho to pop balloons of different colors and shapes. A counter in the top-right corner of the screen shows the correct shape, color and quantity that must be popped.
  • Saving Cascão: as Mônica, the player must help Cascão to cross a river without getting wet, avoiding several moving obstacles.
  • Jigsaw Puzzle: the player must help Franjinha to assemble a jigsaw puzzle within a time limit. The number of pieces increases progressively.
  • Memory Game: the player helps Magali to find pairs of fruits inside little jars. The quantity of pairs and the amount of jars in the screen increases progressively.
  • Coloring with Marina: the player has to paint pictures matching a model on the right side of the screen. The number of colors to paint increases progressively. There is also a free painting tool.
  • Saving Sansão: Cebolinha kidnapped Sansão, Mônica's stuffed rabbit, and she must find it. To do so, she must find her way out of a maze within a time limit.

The game features three levels of difficulty. It also has 30 achievements to be unlocked. Players can also use their Zeeboids in game to keep track of achievements.

sample_screenshots.caption: The intro cutscene. Monica wakes up, takes Sansão (her stuffed rabbit) and goes out to play.
Here you have to blow all purple sausage shaped balloons. The shapes, colors and number of balloons to pop will vary. Higher difficulty settings have more demanding combinations of characteristics.
Magali is hungry as always and Mônica has to find matching fruits in the recipients in a memory game.
Cascão has to cross the river and he's afraid of water, so he asks Mônica to help him.
Checking your notebook. The stars are the achievements won. Here I have one achievement won for each game.

title: Turma da Mônica em Vamos Brincar nº 1

description:
Zeebo F.C. Super League is a soccer game with several rules bended to give the game a more arcadey approach. It features teams of 5 players in non-stop matches with no fouls and no balls out of play. Players can run, dribble, pass, shoot and hit the opponents. When shooting, the longer the button is pressed, the stronger the kick is; when passing, the player can choose to make it a low or an aerial pass.

When assembling a team, the player can make a new captain or import one of his/her Zeeboids. If previously trained on Zeebo F.C. Foot Camp, the Zeeboid will retain its attribute levels from that game. By using the Zeeboid the player also participates on an online ranking and can keep track of achievements unlocked during the game. The team uniform and name can also be customized, and winning games develop the team's attributes (strength, reflexes, precision and control).

The player can select the length of games (with 2, 4 or 8 minutes) and if special powers will or won't be allowed. There are five special powers available:

  • Mega-Ball: the ball knocks down everyone in its way.
  • Wall: a wall is put in front of the goal, stopping any ball, even the Mega-Ball.
  • Giant: the character being controlled by the player grows into a giant, being immune to hits or stunning (even by bombs).
  • Crazy Chicken: a crazy chicken invades the field and takes the ball to the opponent's field.
  • Bomb-Ball: the ball turns into a bomb, stunning the nearby players.

The game features 3 game modes:

  • Campaign: in this mode the player develops the team's attributes and unlocks new opponents as he/she advances in game. There are 5 different leagues in this mode, with 5 stadiums and 5 final bosses (Aztec, Pirate, Zombie, Robot and Boy). The player wins trophies for each league won. There are 3 difficulty levels in this mode: Pro, Champions and Stars.
  • Tournament: the player can arrange a tournament with 4, 8 or 16 teams.
  • Quick play: a quick game with any of the available teams.

The game can be played in single player mode, two players in opposite teams or two players in the same team.

sample_screenshots.caption: Kick off!
The League's table, showing the results so far and your next game.

The forth league, the Liga dos Mortos Vivos (Undead League) has an undead theme and games take place at a cemetery. Here a Bomb-Ball was used when a Crazy Chicken was used, creating a roasted chicken.
Main menu.
The first league podium.

title: Zeebo F.C. Super League

description:
This version of FIFA Soccer 09 features four different game modes:

  • Friendly: select any pair of teams for a match. This mode can be player by one or two players (head-to-head).
  • Challenge: a series of 10 pre-set matches in which the player must achieve a specific result (such as winning by a given score, for instance).
  • Season: the player competes in an entire season of one of the 11 leagues available.
  • Tournament: there are 10 different tournaments for the player to compete.

The game features 3D models that can be controlled in all four directions. The available actions are shoot, pass, long pass, volley and tackle. Each player has his own statistics and a stamina bar which will be depleted if he keeps running. Players can also be changed during gameplay, as well as their functions (captain, for instance). There are 8 different stadiums, 5 different field conditions and 3 camera angles. Other available settings are match duration, difficulty and turning on/off lesions, cards, off-side, overtime and commentary.

sample_screenshots.caption: End of game, Brazil wins!
This is the action camera, with a much closer angle.
Another foul, this one almost a penalty! Brazilian players seem to be nervous.
The replay shows the exact moment when the ball passed the goalie.
The teams are on the field, let's re-enact the fatidical match between Brazil and Germany in 2014 Worldcup (with slightly different teams).

title: FIFA Soccer 09
